alert.note: Alert for Emmet; Kossuth; Palo Alto (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 15 at 11:18AM CDT until March 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Rain Changing to Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday into Thursday night... .A winter storm will track through the region on Thursday with travel impacts likely over portions of northwest and north central Iowa. Rain will change to snow late Thursday morning as a cold front moves through Iowa. The boundary will also bring strong northwest winds. Blowing snow will lead to significantly reduced visibilities over northwest into portions of north central Iowa and may approach blizzard conditions. While much of the snow will end Thursday evening, the wind will remain strong and gusty from the northwest through Friday with blowing snow remaining a concern for travelers. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds gust over 45 mph and possibly as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Iowa. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
